20110126170044.000|20110126170047.000|TR0|
20110126170047.000|20110126170049.000|TR0|Intense in Egypt.  Police in Cairo broke 
20110126170049.000|20110126170052.000|TR0|out their batons today to break up street 
20110126170052.000|20110126170054.000|TR0|protests.  The Egyptian government says 
20110126170054.000|20110126170057.000|TR0|demonstrations will not be tolerated and

20110126170059.000|20110126170102.000|TR0|statement follows unprecedented 
20110126170102.000|20110126170104.000|TR0|anti-government demonstrations Tuesday.

20110126170112.000|20110126170114.000|TR0|of the Union speech last night, he called 
20110126170114.000|20110126170117.000|TR0|for increased investment in technology,

20110126170243.000|20110126170245.000|TR0|lobbyists has rigged the tax code to 
20110126170245.000|20110126170248.000|TR0|benefit particular companies and 
20110126170248.000|20110126170250.000|TR0|industries.  Those with accountants or 
20110126170250.000|20110126170253.000|TR0|lawyers to work the system could end up 
20110126170253.000|20110126170255.000|TR0|paying no taxes at all, but all the rest 
20110126170255.000|20110126170258.000|TR0|are hit with one of the highest corporate 
20110126170258.000|20110126170300.000|TR0|tax rates in the world.  It makes no

20110126170634.000|20110126170637.000|TR0|Wisconsin.
20110126170637.000|20110126170639.000|TR0|
20110126170639.000|20110126170642.000|TR0|LOTHIAN:  That's right.  You know, we

20110126170647.000|20110126170649.000|TR0|of how the race to space led the United 
20110126170649.000|20110126170652.000|TR0|States to come up with new technology, 
20110126170652.000|20110126170654.000|TR0|education, that eventually led to a man on 
20110126170654.000|20110126170657.000|TR0|the moon.  So the connection to this town 
20110126170657.000|20110126170659.000|TR0|is that back in 1962, a 20-pound chunk of 
20110126170659.000|20110126170702.000|TR0|metal landed here in Manitowoc.
20110126170702.000|20110126170705.000|TR0|
20110126170705.000|20110126170707.000|TR0|At first, the police officers who found it 
20110126170707.000|20110126170710.000|TR0|thought it was just a piece of trash from 
20110126170710.000|20110126170712.000|TR0|one of the local foundries.  It turned out 
20110126170712.000|20110126170715.000|TR0|that it was a piece of Sputnik 4.  And so 
20110126170715.000|20110126170717.000|TR0|that's what they're known for here in this 
20110126170717.000|20110126170720.000|TR0|town.
20110126170720.000|20110126170722.000|TR0|

20110126170948.000|20110126170951.000|TR0|We're watching another day of violent 
20110126170951.000|20110126170953.000|TR0|protests against the government of Egypt.  
20110126170953.000|20110126170956.000|TR0|Security forces cracking down hard today.
20110126170956.000|20110126170958.000|TR0|
20110126170958.000|20110126171001.000|TR0|CNN Senior International Correspondent Ben

20110126171003.000|20110126171006.000|TR0|
20110126171006.000|20110126171008.000|TR0|And Ben, what do things look like now?
20110126171008.000|20110126171011.000|TR0|
20110126171011.000|20110126171013.000|TR0|BEN WEDEMAN, CNN SR. INTERNATIONAL 
20110126171013.000|20110126171016.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT:  Things in this particular 
20110126171016.000|20110126171018.000|TR0|area seem calmer.  Just about an hour ago, 
20110126171018.000|20110126171021.000|TR0|however, about 350 protesters were trying 
20110126171021.000|20110126171023.000|TR0|to get up this main artery of Cairo to the 
20110126171023.000|20110126171026.000|TR0|Ministry of Information in the main TV 
20110126171026.000|20110126171029.000|TR0|building.  The police stopped them, and 
20110126171029.000|20110126171031.000|TR0|the crowd seems to have sort of withered 
20110126171031.000|20110126171034.000|TR0|away.
20110126171034.000|20110126171036.000|TR0|
20110126171036.000|20110126171039.000|TR0|But earlier in the day we saw some pretty 
20110126171039.000|20110126171041.000|TR0|intense clashes between protesters and 
20110126171041.000|20110126171044.000|TR0|riot place, because, of course, the 
20110126171044.000|20110126171046.000|TR0|Interior Ministry here put out a statement 
20110126171046.000|20110126171049.000|TR0|this morning saying that there would be 
20110126171049.000|20110126171051.000|TR0|absolutely no tolerance for any sort of 
20110126171051.000|20110126171054.000|TR0|gathering or protest whatsoever.  And what 
20110126171054.000|20110126171056.000|TR0|we've seen is they're putting that policy 
20110126171056.000|20110126171059.000|TR0|into effect, using tear gas, rubber 
20110126171059.000|20110126171101.000|TR0|bullets, and beating, quite mercilessly, 
20110126171101.000|20110126171104.000|TR0|not just protesters, also passersby and, 
20110126171104.000|20110126171106.000|TR0|disturbingly, journalists as well.
20110126171106.000|20110126171109.000|TR0|
20110126171109.000|20110126171111.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  Ben, what's the goal here?  
20110126171111.000|20110126171114.000|TR0|What do protesters want?
20110126171114.000|20110126171116.000|TR0|
20110126171116.000|20110126171119.000|TR0|WEDEMAN:  Well, the protest yesterday was 
20110126171119.000|20110126171121.000|TR0|based around a variety of demands.  They 
20110126171121.000|20110126171124.000|TR0|want a minimum wage.  They want the 
20110126171124.000|20110126171126.000|TR0|minister of the interior to be sacked.
20110126171126.000|20110126171129.000|TR0|
20110126171129.000|20110126171131.000|TR0|But more than anything, more than anything 
20110126171131.000|20110126171134.000|TR0|else, everybody seems to agree on one 
20110126171134.000|20110126171137.000|TR0|single demand.  They want the ouster of 
20110126171137.000|20110126171139.000|TR0|President Hosni Mubarak, who has been the

20110126173459.000|20110126173502.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110126173502.000|20110126173504.000|TR0|

20110126173507.000|20110126173509.000|TR0|glimpse that future.  It was right here
